description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7u158","text":"The aim of this systematic review is to compare the outcomes of burst fracture between non-operative treatments and operative treatments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We are still developing and optimizing this protocol

{"blocks":[{"key":"a5tmn","text":"Risk of bias (quality) assessment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":33}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"68r7p","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvgbq","text":"Dr. Chou and Dr. Chai work independently on risk of bias (limitations) assessment for individual outcomes and body of evidence according to ROBINS-I (Sterne 2016).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1b17f","text":"\nOutcomes listed below is specified to be assessed using GRADE for quality of evidence and presented in the summary of findings (Guyatt, 2011).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"duf08","text":"1. Journal of Clinical Epidemiology 64 (2011) 383e394 doi: 10.1016/j.jclinepi.2010.04.026","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3veas","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dfinc","text":"Sterne JA, Hernán MA, Reeves BC, et al. {"blocks":[{"key":"1n9ls","text":"Strategy for data synthesis","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":27}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2kj7v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4frn2","text":"Qualitative:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"674m6","text":"GRADE for the certainty of evidence. ROBINS-I will be integrated into GRADE according to the dedicated guideline (Schünemann 2019).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3pkdm","text":"
Quantitative:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5e8b4","text":"Meta-analysis is provided if data is appropriate for pooling. Consequently, both fixed-effects and random-effects meta-analysis will be checked, although the random-effects reasonably reflects the reality of the clinical situation. If data is not suitable for pooling, a narrative synthesis will be performed.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqsii","text":"
Randomized and non-randomized studies are separately pooled. Randomized data are pooled as intention-to-treat.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b3fga","text":"
The definitions of confidence interval (CI), heterogeneity, and P value are conventional (CI 95%; I2 < 40%: unimportant; 30%–60%: moderate; 50%–90%: substantial, 75%–100%: considerable; P value <0.05: significant; P interaction <0.1: significant). Web-based GRADEpro GDT was utilized for GRADE. Review Manager 5.3.5 (Copenhagen: The Nordic Cochrane Centre, The Cochrane Collaboration, 2014) was used for meta-analysis. Comprehensive Meta-Analysis (CMA v3; Biostat, Englewood, NJ) was used for funnel plot and Egger's regression test.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":100,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4g30i","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"u0qc","text":"Schünemann HJ, Cuello C, Akl EA, Mustafa RA, Meerpohl JJ, Thayer K, et al; GRADE Working Group. GRADE guidelines: 18. How ROBINS-I and other tools to assess risk of bias in nonrandomized studies should be used to rate the certainty of a body of evidence. J Clin Epidemiol. 2019;111:105–114. doi: 10.1016/j.jclinepi.2018.01.012","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
